itec.minicompiler
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  itec.minicompiler.Parser
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConstantsInterface
public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstantsInterface

The Parser implements a top-down-parser for the PL0-language. It uses the FIRST-Sets of the non-terminals and a lookahead Token, which is one step ahead of the actual position, to check for errors. WEAK- and SYNC-points are used for synchronization and a better resumption after errors. To get these WEAK- and SYNC-points the FOLLOW-Sets of the non-terminals are used.

Version:
1.0 (29.09.2004)
Author:
Stefan Leitner, Stefan Schauer

Constructor Detail

Parser

public Parser(ErrorHandler e,
              Scanner s)
Initialize the Parser with an ErrorHandler e and a Scanner s. Furthermore initialize the FirstSet and FollowSet and the sets of compare-, line- and point-operators. Also the SymbolTable is initialized with the predefined types, constants and procedures.

Parameters:
e - The ErrorHandler the Parser should use
s - The Scanner the Parser gets it's information from
Method Detail

error

private void error(int n)
Call the ErrorHandler with the error number n.

Parameters:
n - The error number of the error which occured

get

private void get()
Get the next Token from the Scanner.

expect

private void expect(int kind,
                    int nonTerminal)
Check wether the next Token is the one which is needed or not. If yes, just read along. Otherwise go to the next SYNC-point using the FOLLOW-Set of the nonTerminal.

Parameters:
kind - The kind of the expected Token
nonTerminal - The non-terminal for which a SYNC-point should be reached

expectWeak

private void expectWeak(int kind)
Check wether the next Token is the one which is needed or not. If yes, just read along. Otherwise throw an error but act like the token was there (i.e. no synchronization has to be done).

Parameters:
kind - The kind of the expected Token

weakSeparator

private boolean weakSeparator(int kind,
                              int nonTerminal)
Check wether a seperator (i.e , or ;) is present. If yes, just read along. Otherwise check if the seperator is really needed or if the statement is finished anyway.

Parameters:
kind - The kind of the expected Token
nonTerminal - The non-terminal
Returns:
True if the seperator is needed or the lookaheadToken is not the expected one, False otherwise

isInFirst

private boolean isInFirst(int nonTerminal)
Return wether the lookaheadToken is in the FIRST-Set of nonTerminal

Parameters:
nonTerminal - The non-terminal for the check
Returns:
True if the lookaheadToken is in the FIRST-Set of nonTerminal, False otherwise

putSymbol

private void putSymbol(Symbol sym)
Insert sym in the actual scope in the SymbolTable if not already present, throw an error otherwise

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol which should be inserted

Pl0 -> "MODULE" ident ";" Declarations ["BEGIN" StatementSequence] "END" ident "."

Implements the grammar-rule:

Declarations -> ["CONST" {ident "=" Expression} ";"] ["TYPE" {ident "=" Type ";"}] ["VAR" Identlist ":" Type ";"] {ProcedureDeclaration ";"}

type

private Type type(Symbol sym)
Implements the grammar-rule:

Type -> (ident|ArrayType|RecordType)

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol the type should be determined for. It is mainly used to check for recursive declarations
Returns:
The Type of s, if it could be determined, an undefined BasicType otherwise

Implements the grammar-rule:

assignment

private void assignment(Symbol sym)
Implements the grammar-rule:

Assignment -> Selector ":=" Expression

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol on the lefthand side of the Assignment (i.e. the Symbol the Selector should be computed for and the Expression should be assigned to)

selector

private Symbol selector(Symbol sym)
Implements the grammar-rule:

Selector -> {("." ident)|("[" Expression "]")}

Parameters:
sym - The Symbol on the lefthand side of the Assignment
Returns:
The very right Symbol of the Selector (i.e. either the Symbol in the RECORD identified by ident or an AddressedSymbol with the very basetype of the ARRAY) or sym itself, if the Selector is empty

procedureCall

private void procedureCall()
Implements the grammar-rule:

ProcedureCall -> "(" [ActualParameters] ")"

actualParameters

private void actualParameters()
Implements the grammar-rule:

ActualParameters -> Expression {"," Expression}

ifStatement

private void ifStatement()
Implements the grammar-rule:

IfStatement -> "IF" Expression "THEN" StatementSequence {"ELSIF" Expression "THEN" StatementSequence} ["ELSE" StatementSequence] "END"

whileStatement

private void whileStatement()
Implements the grammar-rule:

WhileStatement -> "WHILE" Expression "DO" StatementSequence "END"

repeatStatement

private void repeatStatement()
Implements the grammar-rule:

RepeatStaement -> "REPEAT" StatementSequence "UNTIL" Expression

expression

private Type expression()
Implements the grammar-rule:

Expression -> SimpleExpression [("="|"#"|"<"|"<="|">"|">=") SimpleExpression]

Returns:
The Type of the lefthand side of the Expression (because not typechecking is made, any righthand side can be ignored)

simpleExpression

private Type simpleExpression()
Implements the grammar-rule:

SimpleExpression -> ["+"|"-"] Term {("+"|"-"|"OR") Term}

Returns:
The Type of the lefthand side of the SimpleExpression (because not typechecking is made, any righthand side can be ignored)

term

private Type term()
Implements the grammar-rule:

Term -> Factor {("*"|"DIV"|"MOD"|"&") Factor}

Returns:
The Type of the lefthand side of the Term (because not typechecking is made, any righthand side can be ignored)

factor

private Type factor()
Implements the grammar-rule:

Factor -> ((ident Selector)|integer|("("Expression")")|("~" Factor))

Returns:
The Type of the Symbol determined in Factor (i.e. the Type of the ident, the integer, which is the BasicType INTEGER, the Expression or the Factor)
